content:
Note that nightly-2024-04-30 doesn't actually exist yet: I've been working on this with a local toolchain, and we shouldn't expect this to work until about 2024-04-30T19:00:00+10:00 when that nightly comes out and I can update the PR.

Nevertheless, it's time to start looking at the diff. (Expect some rough edges, I haven't looked at all yet!)
I've now created issues #12532, #12534, #12535 to track the uses of the backwards compatibility flags, and linked to those issues from all uses.
As soon as someone can merge #12529 and #12531, I will then cherry-pick those back to bump/v.4.8.0, and then I think #12530 will be ready for review / delegation.
Fantastic, thanks @Johan Commelin. I've done the merges now, and #12530 should now have a clean diff and be ready for a review.
I guess we could backport the change to Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/AffineSpace/AffineMap.lean, which is just stylistic. Lacking enthusiasm right now. :-)
Ah, there are also the changes where we specialize (? maybe? maybe it's a noop?) some universes in algebraic geometry and get a speed up. I guess this should be backported. EDIT: already happened.
For all the reviewers of #12530: the diff is dominated by test/RewriteSearch/Polynomial.lean.
@Kim Morrison Do you think there is any opportunity to get that into a separate PR?
(and that is just re-enabling (most) tests, which had been completely broken earlier)
There's really nothing going on in that file. It was completely commented out, and I've just restored it (except for one test that still fails).
But the diff is not just removing /- and -/ on two lines...
I'm disinclined to worry to much here: rw_search is unfortunately low quality / needs love, and not critical to anyone.
Green! Hopefully nightly-testing will also go green shortly.
It looks good to me -- should I bors +r, squash merge, or something else?
